javadoc: A utility class for managing script directories and ScriptInfo objects.

methods.name: buildUserScriptsDirectory
methods.comment:
User's home scripts directory. Some tests may override the default using the 
 SystemUtilities.USER_SCRIPTS_DIR system property.

return.comment: the path to the default user scripts directory

methods.javadoc:
Stores the time of the refresh request so that clients may later ask when the last 
 refresh took place.
methods.name: refreshRequested
methods.comment:
Stores the time of the refresh request so that clients may later ask when the last 
 refresh took place.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of the default script directories.
@return a list of the default script directories
methods.name: getDefaultScriptDirectories
methods.comment: Returns a list of the default script directories.

return.comment: a list of the default script directories

methods.name: isSystemScriptPath
methods.comment: Determine if the specified file is contained within the Ghidra installation.

return.comment: true if file contained within Ghidra installation area

methods.name: isSystemFile
methods.comment: Determine if the specified file is contained within the Ghidra installation.

return.comment: true if file is contained within Ghidra application root.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of the current script directories.
@return a list of the current script directories
methods.name: getScriptSourceDirectories
methods.comment: Returns a list of the current script directories.

return.comment: a list of the current script directories

methods.javadoc:
Sets the script directories to the new paths.
@param newPaths the new script directories
methods.name: setScriptDirectories
methods.comment: Sets the script directories to the new paths.

methods.name: getScriptPath
methods.comment: Returns the PATH for the specified directory.

return.comment: the path for the specified directory

methods.name: getScriptCompileOutputDirectory
methods.comment:
Returns the output directory to which the given script file's generated .class file should
 be written

return.comment: the directory

methods.name: getClassFileByResourceFile
methods.comment:
Uses the given ResourceFile to find its class file.  This method is needed
 due to the fact that we sometimes can find a class file in more than one location, 
 such as when using an installation version of Ghidra in the same environment as 
 a development version of Ghidra.  We get better debugging when we use the class file
 that is associated with the given source file.

params.name: sourceFile
params.comment: the source file for which to find the generated class file.

params.name: rawName
params.comment: the name of the class, without file extension or path info.

return.comment: the class file generated from the given source file.

methods.name: getScriptBinDirectories
methods.comment: Returns the list of directories to which scripts are compiled.

return.comment: the list

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of directories.  Development directories differ from standard script
 directories in that the former have a bin directory at a different location from 
 the latter, due to the setup of the development environment.
@return Returns a list of directories
methods.name: getDevelopmentScriptBinDirectories
methods.comment:
Returns a list of directories.  Development directories differ from standard script
 directories in that the former have a bin directory at a different location from 
 the latter, due to the setup of the development environment.

return.comment: Returns a list of directories

methods.javadoc: Deletes all script class files.
methods.name: clean
methods.comment: Deletes all script class files.

methods.name: getBaseName
methods.comment:
Returns the base name give a script file.
 For example, given "C:\Temp\SomeClass.java",
 it will return "SomeClass".

return.comment: the base name

methods.name: contains
methods.comment:
Returns true if a ScriptInfo object exists for
 the specified script file.

return.comment: true if a ScriptInfo object exists

methods.javadoc:
Removes the ScriptInfo object for the specified file
@param scriptFile the script file
methods.name: unloadScript
methods.comment: Removes the ScriptInfo object for the specified file

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over all script info objects.
@return an iterator over all script info objects
methods.name: getScriptInfoIterator
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all script info objects.

return.comment: an iterator over all script info objects

methods.name: getScriptInfo
methods.comment: Returns the script info object for the specified script file

return.comment: the script info object for the specified script file

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of all Ghidra script providers
@return a list of all Ghidra script providers
methods.name: getProviders
methods.comment: Returns a list of all Ghidra script providers

return.comment: a list of all Ghidra script providers

methods.name: getProvider
methods.comment:
Returns the corresponding Ghidra script providers
 for the specified script file.

return.comment: the Ghidra script provider

methods.name: hasScriptProvider
methods.comment: Returns true if a provider exists that can process the specified file.

return.comment: true if a provider exists that can process the specified file

methods.name: createNewScript
methods.comment:
Creates a new script with a unique name using the specified provider in the 
 specified directory.

params.name: parentDirectory
params.comment: the directory where the new script will be created.

params.name: scriptDirectories
params.comment:
The list of directories containing scripts (used to find a 
        unique name).

return.comment: the newly created script file

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the given filename exists in any of the given directories
methods.name: findScriptFileInPaths
methods.comment: Returns true if the given filename exists in any of the given directories

methods.name: fixupName
methods.comment:
Fixup name issues, such as package parts in the name and inner class names.
 
 This method can handle names with or without '.java' at the end; names with 
 '$' (inner classes) and names with '.' characters for package separators

return.comment: the name as a '.java' file path (with '/'s and not '.'s)

methods.name: findScriptByName
methods.comment:
Uses the given name to find a matching script.  This method only works because of the
 limitation that all script names in Ghidra must be unique.  If the given name has multiple
 script matches, then a warning will be logged.

params.name: name
params.comment: The name for which to find a script

return.comment: The ScriptInfo that has the given name

methods.name: alreadyExists
methods.comment:
Looks through all of the current ScriptInfos to see if one already exists with 
 the given name.

return.comment: true if the name is not taken by an existing ScriptInfo.

methods.name: getExistingScriptInfo
methods.comment:
Returns the existing script info for the given name.  The script environment limits 
 scripts such that names are unique.  If this method returns a non-null value, then the 
 name given name is taken.

params.name: scriptName
params.comment: the name of the script for which to get a ScriptInfo

return.comment:
a ScriptInfo matching the given name; null if no script by that name is known to
         the script manager

methods.name: runScript
methods.comment: Runs the specified script with the specified state

params.name: scriptState
params.comment: state representing environment variables that the script is able to access

params.name: writer
params.comment: the writer to which warning and error messages will be written

params.name: originator
params.comment: the client class requesting the script run; used for logging

return.comment: whether the script successfully completed running

methods.javadoc: Updates every known script's duplicate value.
methods.name: refreshDuplicates
methods.comment: Updates every known script's duplicate value.

name: GhidraScriptUtil
comment: A utility class for managing script directories and ScriptInfo objects.

fields.javadoc: The last time a request was made to refresh
fields.name: lastRefreshRequestTimestamp
fields.comment: The last time a request was made to refresh
